content: this amigurumi was inspired by * ohagi 1 * おはぎ a traditional japanese confection made of lightly pounded glutinous rice covered with chunky azuki bean paste the *kinako ohagi* is a variation that uses soybean powder 2 *ohagi* is traditionally offered during the autumn ohigan 3 御彼岸 a week-long japanese buddhist holiday in which the japanese pay respects to their ancestors **pattern notes** the *ohagi* pattern uses the mini bean stitch 4 a type of textured cluster stitch this stitch is similar to the crochet puff but is less puffy it can be a little difficult or unfamiliar for new beginners the *kinako ohagi* version is not technically difficult as it is made with only single_crochet stitches worked in the round but the pattern involves using chenille yarn which can be challenging my tip for this is to use stitch markers or yarn scraps to mark the stitches and rounds to make counting and crocheting easier **materials & tools** yarn fingering or sports weight - burgundy / maroon / dark red and sand coloured chenille yarn bouclé yarn also works 2 5 mm crochet hook stuffing stitch markers scissors yarn needle safety eyes embroidery thread optional i used scheepjes organicon no 243 cherry jam and ruyi niao xiao ke ai chenille fluffy 如意鸟小可爱 no 14 2 strands only **crochet techniques** this pattern uses us crochet terms and consists of the following stitches single_crochet single_crochet stitch increase single_crochet increase decrease single_crochet decrease mb mini bean stitch 5 mb-increase mini bean stitch increase mb-decrease mini bean stitch decrease **finished size** approx 4 5cm x 3 8cm x 3cm ----- ©all rights reserved unless stated otherwise the content and images are mine please do not sell copy or distribute them without my express consent sharing of the pattern is welcomed to share the pattern please link to the pattern post 6 and include my instagram profile @yotsuba_blythes 7 with proper attribution sale of limited quantities of the finished items made from this pattern is permitted and please include my website 8 and instagram profile 9 as attribution for the pattern 1 https //www okonomikitchen com/ohagi-botamochi/ 2 https //kokorocares com/blogs/blog/kinako-chronicles-a-tale-of-soybeans-and-sweets 3 https //en wikipedia org/wiki/higan 4 https //firstthecoffee com/how-to-crochet-the-mini-bean-stitch/ 5 https //firstthecoffee com/how-to-crochet-the-mini-bean-stitch/ 6 https //yotsub4 blogspot com/2025/09/ohigan-wagashi-crochet-ohagi html 7 https //www instagram com/yotsuba_blythes/ 8 https //yotsub4 blogspot com/2025/09/ohigan-wagashi-crochet-ohagi html 9 https //www instagram com/yotsuba_blythes/
